name: 30 Arm Circles
warmUp: Stand tall and extend your arms out to the sides. Make small circles with your arms, gradually increasing the size. Perform for 30 seconds to effectively warm up your shoulders and arms.

name: 15 High Knees
warmUp: Incorporate high knees into your warm-up routine to activate your legs. Focus on driving your knees up towards your chest while maintaining a brisk pace. Consider marching in place instead of jumping.

name: 10 Sumo Squats
warmUp: Loosen up your hips and legs by performing gentle hip circles and side lunges. This will help prepare your lower body for the sumo squat movement.

name: Run for 2 Min
warmUp: Start with a light jog, gradually increasing your pace. This will help to gradually elevate your heart rate and warm up your entire body. Consider a brisk walk instead of running.

name: 10 Pelvic Tilts
warmUp: Engage your core with gentle torso twists and side bends to warm up your abdomen. This will help activate the muscles you'll use during pelvic tilts.

name: 10 Side-Lying Leg Lifts
warmUp: Warm up your hips with light stretches, such as seated forward bends and gentle hip flexor stretches. This exercise helps strengthen the hip muscles without straining the core.

name: 10 Seated Leg Extensions
warmUp: Sit on a chair with your back straight. Extend one leg out in front of you, keeping it straight, then lower it back down. Alternate legs to strengthen your quadriceps without straining your core.

name: 10 Wall Slides
warmUp: Stand with your back against a wall and slide your arms up and down while keeping your elbows and wrists in contact with the wall. This helps strengthen the upper body and improve posture.

name: 10 Glute Bridges
warmUp: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Lift your hips towards the ceiling, squeezing your glutes at the top. This exercise strengthens the glutes and hamstrings without straining the core.

name: Wild Card (roller's choice!)
warmUp: Choose any warm-up exercise that you enjoy, such as jumping jacks or dynamic stretches, to get your body ready and energized for the workout.
